Utterance: <synch>
Hi again! It's nice to see you. How have you been since our last session?
I've been good, just keeping busy with work and stuff.
That's great to hear. Did you have a chance to think about any of the topics we discussed last time?
A little bit. I thought about my family visits and how much they mean to me.
That’s wonderful. Family can be such a strong support system. How did those thoughts make you feel?
They made me feel happy, just remembering the good times.
Happy is a great feeling. Have you had any family visits since we last talked?
Not yet, but I’m planning one for the holidays.
That sounds exciting! Do you have any specific plans for the visit?
Just spending time together, maybe going out to eat and catching up.
That sounds lovely. Spending quality time can really strengthen those bonds. How do you usually feel when you’re with your family?
I feel relaxed and comfortable. It’s nice to be around them.
That’s good to hear. Have you noticed any changes in your mood or behavior lately, especially when you’re busy?
I think I get a bit more stressed when I have a lot going on.
Stress can definitely creep in. What do you usually do to cope with that stress?
I try to listen to music or go to the gym.
Those are great strategies. How effective do you find them in managing your stress?
They help a lot. Working out really clears my head.
That’s fantastic. Physical activity can be a great release. Have you had any moments recently where you felt overwhelmed?
Yeah, sometimes at work, when deadlines are tight.
Understandable. How do you typically handle those moments?
I usually just push through it, but sometimes I feel like I might snap.
It’s good that you recognize that feeling. Would you like to explore some additional coping strategies for those moments?
Sure, that would be helpful.
One technique could be mindfulness or deep breathing exercises. Have you ever tried them?
Not really, but I’ve heard they can help.
They can be quite effective. Would you be open to trying a short breathing exercise together?
Yeah, let’s do it.
Great! Let’s take a deep breath in for four counts... hold it for four... and breathe out for six.
<breathes>
How did that feel?
It felt nice, actually. Calming.
I’m glad to hear that. You can use that technique anytime you start to feel overwhelmed.
I’ll definitely try to remember that.
Awesome! Is there anything else on your mind that you'd like to talk about today?
I’ve been thinking about my friendships a lot, too.
That’s an important topic. What specifically about your friendships has been on your mind?
I really value them, but sometimes I worry that I’m not a good enough friend.
It’s natural to have those thoughts. Can you tell me more about why you feel that way?

Have you had any recent experiences that made you feel this way?

It’s understandable to be busy. How do you think your friends feel about that?

It’s good to acknowledge that guilt. Have you had the chance to communicate with them about your feelings?

Would it be helpful to share your feelings with them? Sometimes, opening up can strengthen those connections.

Before we wrap up, is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
No, I think we covered a lot.
I’m glad to hear that. Thank you for sharing today, and I look forward to hearing about your family visit and your conversations with your friends next time!
Thank you, Ellie. See you next time!
